snippet: In recent years, government commissions, parliamentary inquiries and civil society groups have all pointed to serious shortfalls in the disbursement of oil revenues.
abstract: Nigeria has been thrown into turmoil following exposure of large-scale oil corruption scheme by Lamido Sansui, governor of country's central bank; while fraud is commonplace in Nigeria, accusations by an official at Sansui's level of influence are unprecedented, and have cut close to nation's oil-power nexus, penetrating heart of country's entrenched corruption.
lead_paragraph: In recent years, government commissions, parliamentary inquiries and civil society groups have all pointed to serious shortfalls in the disbursement of oil revenues.

headline.main: Nigerians Ask Why Oil Funds Are Missing
headline.print_headline: Nigerians Ask Why Oil Funds Are Missing
